entry.tran: (人或牲畜)喷鼻息;(人表示不赞成、可笑等)哼鼻子，嗤之以鼻
entry.def: When people or animals snort, they breathe air noisily out through their noses. People sometimes snort in order to express disapproval or amusement.

example.ex: He snorted loudly and shook his head.
example.tran: 他响亮地哼了一声，摇了摇头。

entry.def: If someone snorts something, they say it in a way that shows contempt.

example.tran: “报告，”他哼着鼻子说，“谁都会写。”

entry.def: To snort a drug such as cocaine means to breathe it in quickly through your nose.

example.ex: He died of cardiac arrest after snorting cocaine.
example.tran: 他死于吸食可卡因之后的心脏停搏。

means.word_mean: 1. breathing noisily and forcefully through the nostrils;
